Miscellaneous Highlights: Falling fog temporarily halted the table-topping India versus New Zealand match during the 16th over of the second innings.
Others: The match resumed shortly after the fog cleared, with Mohammed Shami taking five wickets and Virat Kohli scoring 95 runs to help India secure a win.
The venue in Dharamsala sits at an altitude of 1457 metres and is known for its unique playing conditions due to the high altitude and surrounding Himalayas.
